member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.ContinueDifferencePredicate`1
member.summary: A predicate used by Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffFinder that allows callers to stop differencing prematurely.
member.param: The current index in the original sequence being differenced.
The original sequence being differenced.
The length of the longest match so far.
member.returns: true if the algorithm should continue processing, false to stop the algorithm.
member.remarks: When false is returned, the algorithm stops searching for matches and uses the information it has computed so far to create the Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.IDiffChange[] array that will be returned.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeType
member.summary: An enumeration of the possible change types for a difference operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeType.Insert
member.summary: Content was inserted into the modified sequence.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeType.Delete
member.summary: Content was deleted from the original sequence.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeType.Change
member.summary: Content from the original sequence has changed in the modified sequence.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffLineTokenizer
member.summary: Utility class which tokenizes the given stream into string tokens. Each token represents a line from the file as delimited by common EOL sequences. (\n, \r\n, \r, \u2028, \u2029, \u85)

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffLineTokenizer.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Constructs a new DiffLineTokenizer for the given stream and encoding.
member.param: The stream to tokenize.
The character encoding of the bytes in the stream. If null, this will be automatically detected.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffLineTokenizer.FillBuffer
member.summary: Fills up the internal buffer with characters from the stream. Returns the number of characters in the buffer and resets the current buffer position. Returns 0 when EOF.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffLineTokenizer.NextLineToken(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.EndOfLineTerminator@)
member.summary: Gets the next line token as a string from the stream.
member.returns: The next token. Returns null when the end of stream has been reached.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeHelper
member.summary: A utility class which helps to create the set of DiffChanges from a difference operation. This class accepts original DiffElements and modified DiffElements that are involved in a particular change. The MarktNextChange() method can be called to mark the seration between distinct changes. At the end, the Changes property can be called to retrieve the constructed changes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeHelper.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new DiffChangeHelper for the given DiffSequences.
member.param: The original sequence.
The modified sequence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeHelper.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the resources used by this helper class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeHelper.MarkNextChange
member.summary: Marks the beginning of the next change in the set of differences.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeHelper.AddOriginalElement(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds the original element at the given position to the elements affected by the current change. The modified index gives context to the change position with respect to the original sequence.
member.param: The index of the original element to add.
The index of the modified element that provides corresponding position in the modified sequence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeHelper.AddModifiedElement(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds the modified element at the given position to the elements affected by the current change. The original index gives context to the change position with respect to the modified sequence.
member.param: The index of the original element that provides corresponding position in the original sequence.
The index of the modified element to add.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeHelper.Changes
member.summary: Retrieves all of the changes marked by the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffChangeHelper.ReverseChanges
member.summary: Retrieves all of the changes marked by the class in the reverse order

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.DiffFinder`1.ComputeUniqueIdentifiers(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
This method hashes element groups within the specified range and assigns unique identifiers to identical elements.
This greatly speeds up element comparison as we may compare integers instead of having to look at element content.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.FileTypeUtil.TryDetermineTextEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Determines the encoding for a file by first checking for the Unicode byte order mark. If it is Unicode, the particular encoding is returned. If it does not contain the Unicode BOM, it's trying to detect utf8 encoding by scanning first 1024 bytes of the file. If it fails, or exception is thrown it returns the current encoding is returned (aka the OEM code page).
member.param: Canonicalized path to the file to check
member.returns: the encoding for the file or OEM code page if exception was thrown

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.FileTypeUtil.DetermineEncoding(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Determines the encoding for a file by first checking for the Unicode byte order mark. If it is Unicode, the particular encoding is returned. If it does not contain the Unicode BOM, it's trying to detect utf8 encoding by scanning first 1024 bytes of the file. If utf8 is not detected and checkForBinary is false, the current encoding is returned (aka the OEM code page). When checkForBinary is true and the file does not contain the BOM, the encoding returned is null if there are NUL bytes in the first 1K of the file or is the current encoding if there are no NUL bytes. It throws exception if file is missing or is a directory.
member.param: Canonicalized path to the file to check
if true, check the file for null bytes
The encoding to fall back to if a unicode encoding was not detected and the file was not detected to contain only ASCII characters
member.returns: the encoding for the file or null if checkForBinary is true and NUL characters are present in the file

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.FileTypeUtil.DetermineEncoding(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Determines the encoding for a file by first checking for the Unicode byte order mark. If it is Unicode, the particular encoding is returned. If it does not contain the Unicode BOM, it's trying to detect utf8 encoding by scanning first 1024 bytes of the file. If utf8 is not detected and checkForBinary is false, the current encoding is returned (aka the OEM code page). When checkForBinary is true and the file does not contain the BOM, the encoding returned is null if there are NUL bytes in the first 1K of the file or is the current encoding if there are no NUL bytes. It throws exception if file is missing or is a directory.
member.param: Stream to check
if true, check the file for null bytes
The encoding to fall back to if a unicode encoding was not detected and the stream was not detected to contain only ASCII characters
member.returns: the encoding for the file or null if checkForBinary is true and NUL characters are present in the file

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.FileTypeUtil.DetermineEncoding(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,System.Text.Encoding,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determines the encoding for a file by first checking for the Unicode byte order mark. If it is Unicode, the particular encoding is returned. If it does not contain the Unicode BOM, it's trying to detect utf8 encoding by scanning first 1024 bytes of the file. If utf8 is not detected and checkForBinary is false, the current encoding is returned (aka the OEM code page). When checkForBinary is true and the file does not contain the BOM, the encoding returned is null if there are NUL bytes in the first 1K of the file or is the current encoding if there are no NUL bytes. It throws exception if file is missing or is a directory.
member.param: Stream to check
if true, check the file for null bytes
The encoding to fall back to if a unicode encoding was not detected and the stream was not detected to contain only ASCII characters
member.returns: the encoding for the file or null if checkForBinary is true and NUL characters are present in the file

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.FileTypeUtil.FindMatchingEncoding(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Finds the encoding with the matching preamble, if any.
member.param: the buffer to check
the length of valid bytes in the buffer
returned true if the file is a PDF; false otherwise
member.returns: the encoding that matches or null

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.FileTypeUtil.GetUTF8Info(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.IO.Stream,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.UTF8Flags@)
member.summary: Port of vscommon\unilib\utf.cpp::GetUTF8Info Analyzes byte array checking if it contains valid and invalid utf8 characters.
member.param: Array of bytes, representing string in unknown encoding.
Number of bytes in the array to analyze

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.LcsDiff`1
member.summary: An implementation of the difference algorithm described in "An O(ND) Difference Algorithm and its Variations" by Eugene W. Myers

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.LcsDiff`1.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs the DiffFinder

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.LcsDiff`1.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes resources uses by this DiffFinder

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.LcsDiff`1.ComputeDiff(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the differences between the original and modified input sequences on the bounded range.
member.returns: An array of the differences between the two input sequences.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.LcsDiff`1.ComputeDiffRecursive(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Private helper method which computes the differences on the bounded range recursively.
member.returns: An array of the differences between the two input sequences.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.LcsDiff`1.ComputeRecursionPoint(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Given the range to compute the diff on, this method finds the point: (midOriginal, midModified) that exists in the middle of the LCS of the two sequences and is the point at which the LCS problem may be broken down recursively. This method will try to keep the LCS trace in memory. If the LCS recursion point is calculated and the full trace is available in memory, then this method will return the change list.
member.param: The start bound of the original sequence range
The end bound of the original sequence range
The start bound of the modified sequence range
The end bound of the modified sequence range
The middle point of the original sequence range
The middle point of the modified sequence range
member.returns: The diff changes, if available, otherwise null

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.LcsDiff`1.ShiftChanges(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.IDiffChange[])
member.summary: Shifts the given changes to provide a more intuitive diff. While the first element in a diff matches the first element after the diff, we shift the diff down.
member.param: The list of changes to shift
member.returns: The shifted changes

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.LcsDiff`1.ConcatenateChanges(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.IDiffChange[],Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.IDiffChange[])
member.summary: Concatentates the two input DiffChange lists and returns the resulting list.
member.param: The left changes
The right changes
member.returns: The concatenated list

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.LcsDiff`1.ChangesOverlap(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.IDiffChange,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.IDiffChange,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.IDiffChange@)
member.summary: Returns true if the two changes overlap and can be merged into a single change
member.param: The left change
The right change
The merged change if the two overlap, null otherwise
member.returns: True if the two changes overlap

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Diff.LcsDiff`1.ClipDiagonalBound(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Helper method used to clip a diagonal index to the range of valid diagonals. This also decides whether or not the diagonal index, if it exceeds the boundary, should be clipped to the boundary or clipped one inside the boundary depending on the Even/Odd status of the boundary and numDifferences.
member.param: The index of the diagonal to clip.
The current number of differences being iterated upon.
The base reference diagonal.
The total number of diagonals.
member.returns: The clipped diagonal index.
